comments.commentBody:
OK, look, I am certainly no supporter of President Trump, but right now, he's the only President we have (possibly other than Bannon ).

Claiming he is ignoring urgent matters while tweeting ephemera in his bathrobe is the same as the claim above that President Obama spent his time yammering about climate change instead of concentrating on serious issues.

You don't know, you can't know, and this kind of complaining, though it may feel good for a moment does nobody any good and contributes to the impression of an unfocused, fracturing, weakened America...

When, President for Life Kim, the truth is everyone here is United in disliking you and your murdering government, make no mistake.

Well we know that Obama waged Cyberwarfare against both the Iranians and North Koreans, one has to wonder if he also waged Cyberwarfare against the Russians too in reprisal for the Crimea. If so the alleged  Russian Hacking of the Democratic Party could well have been a reprisal for that!

I read that book too and several others about North Korea including "The Girl With Seven Names" (highly recommend). I couldn't agree with you more. Why are we not interfering? Is it because it would antagonize China?
Look at the dim bulb we have in the White House and despair!  All he cares about, like his North Korean counterpart, is maintaining a personality cult at public expense, come what may...
Thank God we have Mr. Trump as our President.  Only he can save us. He said so himself.

Before G. W. Bush claimed NK a terriorist supporter, they were dismantling the nuclear warfare program, thanks to the so called 'leftest' South Korean presidents: Kim DaeJung, and Roh MooHyun. It was long and painful negotiation progress that 6 countries (US, Russia, China, Japan, SK, NK) but it was happening.

But after 'rightest' SK government, Lee MyungBak and Park GunHyae, SK abandoned such peaceful approach to please US right wings (especially the ones backed by weapons manufacturers and blessed by G. W. Bush) and dismantled all the peace effort to NK including Gae-Sung industrial complex and GumGang San tourism.

The only solution on this problem is one and only 'peace'. And yes, Kim JungEun is crazy at best. But accelerating tension will cause arms race at the best case which costs tons of taxpayer money from infrastructure rebuilding and social security (including the ACA.)

We can only hope current president is smart enough to understand another cold war only deprecates his property value.
Is there any covert government action that should not be reported and then editorialized? Or does this follow "All the News That's Fit to Print"?
Your comment hits the nail on the head, and in just one sentence.
We cannot count on China to take him out. We need to grow up and solve our own problems.

McConnell times fifty is nowhere near enough. Both Dems and press must attack Trump relentlessly. Expose his childish insanity. His incompetence. His utter cluelessness.
Attack. Attack. Attack.
Hey, he will say "well, um, I think (re: hope) our generals will know what to do".
Look at a map.  Seoul is well within range of convention N. Korean artillery.  Or do they not matter?

It strikes me, Diogenes, that your comment reflects exactly what many Westerners were thinking about the USSR in 1950. History repeats itself.

By the way, didn't I see you on the beach at Thessaloniki some time ago?
Thank you to President Clinton and Secretary of State Christopher for creating this mess.
Presidents have been dealing with this "mess" for 30 years or more. You can't lay it on any one president, Democrat or Republican.

Seeing photos of missiles rolling down the streets of Pyongyang made me wonder how long until the unstable and insecure "First Runner-up in the 2016 Presidential Election" orders a few truckloads of our ICBMs to go rumbling down Pennsylvania Avenue in a counter show of strength.
So-called president trump is a fake.
The shoe is on the other foot now. We had 8 years of GOP obstructionism but now Republicans are whining because Democrats are not rolling over for Trump and his Russian cronies?

Two wrongs still do not make a right, but this article reminds me of the lie that "Those Russians, those Chinese are launching cyber attacks against us...they manipulate our elections, they spy on us, they do bad things..."

Of course they do! We are doing it to them, and many others, all the time, and quite possibly we did it first. We need to be reminded of this, often.

And this example, North Korea, is simply the one we are now being allowed (or urged??) to think about--"Watch out, a rabid mouse in the corner, we need to do____!"

(I don't even want to think about the possibilities of US response, given our current "leadership." Hope to be alive to see my next birthday...)

Can't someone stop this man from tweeting.  His tweets are spontaneous and not well thought out policy statements that could lead us down the road to nuclear annihilation.  (Hello Ivanka, you seem to be the only one who has the influence necessary to stop your dad's dangerous tweeting.)   To Mr. Trump I quote from a Talking Heads song: "This ain't no disco, this ain't no party, this ain't no fooling around..."

Don't be so dramatic. If there was any hint that Obama colluded with the Russians in the 2008 election the reaction from the right would have been ten times worse. Hell they went nuts when Obama introduced legislation , the ACA, trying to get all Americans healthcare. Like I wrote in an earlier comment if Trumps North Korea policy doesn't work it'll be someone else's fault. Just like the lost Navy Seal,it was the Generals fault. If you're going to be President you need to be able to handle more than one crisis at a time and the Russian thing is of their own making. Are you suggesting that as long as there are problems i the world the press shouldn't hold the President accountable so he can 'concentrate'?
Yeah. Obama took his eye off the ball when he decided to focus on Kim Jong-un instead of the real brains in the North, Kin Hong-un.
Wow, we have a clown in charge of a complex security mess.  God help us !

There are a lot of us who still wish we had that
"weakling" in office -- instead of what's there now.

This problem predated Obama. North Korea has been developing its nuclear capabilities since the late 60s. It signed the Nuclear Proliferation Treaty in 1985 In 1992 it signed the IAEA safeguards agreement but denied access to nuclear waste sites in 1993. It's been game on since then. Presidents since George H W Bush have been trying to deal with the Korean problem with little success.
No, it is not. Good joke, however.

I like Uber, I use it when I need a ride to the airport. I was surprised that all this had come out about them including the good ole boys club mentality, etc. But I guess very successful companies are going to have their dark side. I hope they decide to change things for the better instead of just rearranging the furniture on the Titanic.

This piece is a classic example of what is wrong with our modern politics.

Mr. Trump is the president, not a national arbiter of style, taste, cuisine, fashion, etc. The dreadful image of presidents (and their spouses) as a celebrity, a fairly recent phenomenon has done much to distort the image and reality of the office, with people thinking (especially if they agree with the incumbent) that the president is the be all and end all of government, THE government itself in some cases, the national dryer of tears who must appear at virtually every disaster "to show he cares", whose opinion is sought on the most inane of issues like who will win the Super Bowl or a college tournament, joking on late night TV shows, etc. Frankly, it's pathetic.

I do care about President Trump's policies and the like - I couldn't care less what he has for breakfast, lunch or dinner!
